intro: Mammillaria huajuapensis, commonly known as the Huajuapán cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a ribbed structure and typically has white or pale green spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
